description: From international scientific vocabulary, from New Latin, from natriuresis +‎ -etic = natr- +‎ -i- + uresis + etic; the combining forms are ultimately from New Latin natrium (“sodium”) +‎ Ancient Greek οὔρησις (oúrēsis, “a making water”).

adjectives.description: natriuretic (comparative more natriuretic, superlative most natriuretic)

entries.meaning: Any substance that inhibits the reabsorption of cations, especially sodium, from urine.
